name: Unnamed Project

entity_types.name: TechCorporation
entity_types.description: Large technology companies that design, manufacture, and market consumer electronics.

attributes.name: legal_name
attributes.description: The full legal name of the corporation.

attributes.name: market_sector
attributes.description: The specific sector of technology they dominate.

entity_types.name: TechInfluencer
entity_types.description: Individuals or social media personalities who review and provide opinions on new gadgets.

attributes.name: handle
attributes.description: Social media username or handle.

attributes.name: subscriber_count
attributes.description: Approximate number of followers or subscribers.

entity_types.name: IndustryAnalyst
entity_types.description: Experts who analyze market trends, financial performance, and future technology shifts.

attributes.name: firm_affiliation
attributes.description: The financial or research firm the analyst works for.

attributes.name: specialization
attributes.description: The specific market niche they analyze.

entity_types.name: TechJournalist
entity_types.description: Professional reporters who write for news outlets covering technology breakthroughs.

attributes.name: publication_name
attributes.description: The news organization they write for.

attributes.name: beat
attributes.description: The specific topic area they cover.

entity_types.name: Executive
entity_types.description: High-level leaders of technology companies who make public announcements.

attributes.name: job_title
attributes.description: The official title of the executive.

attributes.name: company_affiliation
attributes.description: The company they lead.

entity_types.name: ResearchInstitute
entity_types.description: Organizations focused on developing new technologies like quantum batteries or displays.

attributes.name: research_focus
attributes.description: The primary area of scientific inquiry.

attributes.name: location_city
attributes.description: The city where the institute is based.

entity_types.name: Investor
entity_types.description: Individuals or entities that trade stocks based on market trends and product releases.

attributes.name: investor_class
attributes.description: Whether they are institutional or retail investors.

attributes.name: portfolio_size
attributes.description: General scale of their investment holdings.

entity_types.name: RegulatoryBody
entity_types.description: Government agencies that oversee competition and technology standards.

attributes.name: jurisdiction
attributes.description: The country or region they regulate.

attributes.name: authority_level
attributes.description: The scope of their legal power.

entity_types.name: Person
entity_types.description: Fallback type for any natural person not fitting specific categories.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: The person's full name.

attributes.name: user_bio
attributes.description: Short biography of the individual.

entity_types.name: Organization
entity_types.description: Fallback type for any group or entity not fitting specific categories.

attributes.name: org_name
attributes.description: The name of the organization.

attributes.name: industry
attributes.description: The industry the organization operates in.

edge_types.name: COMPETES_WITH
edge_types.description: Indicates direct market competition between two entities.

edge_types.name: REVIEWS_PRODUCT_OF
edge_types.description: An influencer or journalist reviewing a product from a corporation.

edge_types.name: PREDICTS_TREND_FOR
edge_types.description: An analyst making a prediction about a company or market.

edge_types.name: WORKS_FOR
edge_types.description: A person or executive employed by an organization.

edge_types.name: INVESTS_IN
edge_types.description: An investor putting capital into a corporation.

edge_types.name: RESPONDS_TO
edge_types.description: One entity publicly reacting to the actions or posts of another.

edge_types.name: REGULATES
edge_types.description: A regulatory body overseeing a corporation's activities.

analysis_summary: The ontology is designed to simulate the social media discourse surrounding the 2025 smartphone market battle between Apple and Samsung. It focuses on the key actors: the corporations themselves, the influencers and journalists who shape public perception, the analysts who predict market shifts, and the investors who react to these trends. Fallback types ensure all social media participants can be categorized.
